original: KÄRNEKULL, Carl Olof, Direktör, över-ingrenjör, Stockholm, f Jkp 25/10 85 av skepps-klarer A Andersson o Mathilda Erikson, gm Astis Hamfeldt (d). Studex 07, ex KTH 12. Avd.ing ensk jvg 12—16, bitr ing SJ 17—19, disp.ass Avesta jvk 19—21, ordf Avesta byggn.-nmd 19, övering o chef Ind.byråns org.avd, Sv ind.frb sed. 21, dir där fr 44. Komm.-kt)ll USA-stip o IVA d :o 22, studieres England, Tyskland, Frankrike USA 27—38, sakk finansdep rör förv av flottans varv 28, för-sv.dep rör flygvapn verkst mm 31, marinför-valtn rör varvsorg v Sthlms örlogsv 33, sakk i org.fråg h Sthlms fastigh.nmd, ind.v.styr mfl 34—35, led Sthlm kommun omorg.komm:» expertdeleg 39—40, styr.led Sv tekn.frn 31—38, medstift dess avd f industr ekon o org 31, styr.led Sv konsult ing frn 37, ordf sed. 41, led Sv nät.komm f ration org fr 37, 1. v. ordf sed. 39, Sv repr v 7. internat kongr i ration org Washington 38. Styr.suppl i Statens hantv.inst sed. 44. Member of Amer Soc Mach Engineers. Av trycket: Modern arb.ledn 21. Om sparsamh inom industr drift 22, Den fabrikmäss driftens org 27, Hur man org ett af f.f öret 24 (4 uppl 38), Flytande tillv 30, Driftsekon 31, Planering inom stålind 38, Ration arb.ledn :s tillämpn på nybyggn av hdlsfartyg 40, art i tekn o ekon ämn, red Sv Ind.frb :s Rationalis Revy sed. 29. RVO. Hobby : Ordleksforskn.
translated: KÄRNEKULL, Carl Olof, Director, Senior Chief Engineer, Stockholm, born Jönköping 25/10 1885, son of ship clerk A Andersson and Mathilda Erikson, married to Astis Hamfeldt (deceased). Graduate 1907, ex Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) 1912. Department engineer at private railway 1912-1916, Assistant Engineer at Swedish Railways 1917-1919, Dispatcher Assistant at Avesta private railway 1919-1921, Chairman of Avesta Building Committee 1919, Senior Engineer and Head of Industrial Bureau's Organizational Department at Swedish Industrial Federation since 1921, Director since 1944. Commissioned Officer in the USA and member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences since 1922, studied in England, Germany, France, and USA 1927-1938. Expert at the Financial Department regarding naval shipyards in 1928, at the Defense Department regarding Air Force workshops, etc. in 1931, Naval Administration for shipyard organization at Stockholm naval base in 1933, expert in organizational matters for the Stockholm Real Estate Committee, industrial plant control authority, etc. in 1934-1935, member of the Stockholm Municipal Reorganization Committee's expert delegation in 1939-1940, board member of the Swedish Technical Association 1931-1938, co-founder of its department of industrial economy and organization in 1931, board member of the Swedish Consulting Engineers from 1937, Chairman since 1941, member of the Swedish rationing organization from 1937, First Vice-Chairman since 1939, Swedish representative at the 7th International Congress on Organization in Washington in 1938. Board substitute at the State Craft Institute since 1944. Member of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers. Publications: Modern Industrial Management 1921, Organization of Economical Work within Industry 1922, Organizing a Departmental Business 1924 (4th edition 1938), Progressive Manufacturing 1930, Economic Operation 1931, Planning Within the Steel Industry 1938, Rational Management Applied to the Construction of Merchant Vessels 1940, articles in technical and economic subjects, editor of the Swedish Industrial Federation's Rationalization Review since 1929. Received the Royal Order of Vasa. Hobby: Wordplay research.
